definition: Peking ape-man/Homo erectus pekinensis (c. 600,000 BC), discovered in Zhoukoudian 周口店[Zhou1 kou3 dian4] in 1921
abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: The fossil (skull) of "Peking Man" (LPP) discovered in Zhoukoudian, Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京猿人頭骨化石在周口店發現。

sentences.english: Lisa really enjoyed visiting Peking Man's home.
sentences.chinese: 莉薩真的很喜歡參觀北京猿人的遺址。

sentences.english: In the1920s, archaeologists discovered the complete skull of Peking Man.
sentences.chinese: 考古學家發現了一塊完整的北京猿人顱骨，口譯。

sentences.english: To about 20 million years ago, Peking Man was away from here.
sentences.chinese: 到約20萬年前，北京猿人才離此而去。

sentences.english: Peking Man lived in a cave.
Findings indicate that Peking Man had discovered how to make fires.
sentences.chinese: 出土的一些文物表明北京猿人已發現瞭如何生火。

sentences.english: Peking Man lived 690000 years ago, during Paleolithic times.
sentences.chinese: 北京猿人生活在六十九萬年前的舊石器時代。

definition: ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
Zhoukoudian prehistoric site in Fangshan district 房山區|房山区[Fang2 shan1 qu1], Beijing
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
